law.text:
As used in KRS 237.210 and 237.220:
"Shooting range" or "range" means an area designated and operated by a person for the shooting of firearms and not available for that use by the general public without payment of a fee, membership contribution, or dues, or by invitation of an authorized person; or any area so designated and operated by a unit of government, regardless of the terms of admission thereto.
"Unit of government" means any of the departments of state government or political subdivisions of the state, cities, counties, urban-counties, or charter counties, or any of their respective departments, agencies, or authorities.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 8, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
